verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Korah <S%H7141><s%>, Maschil <S%H4905><s%>. We have heard <S%H8085><s%> with our ears <S%H241><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>, our fathers <S%H1><s%> have told <S%H5608><s%> us, what work <S%H6467><s%> thou didst <S%H6466><s%> in their days <S%H3117><s%>, in the times <S%H3117><s%> of old <S%H6924><s%>.

How thou didst drive out <S%H3423><s%> the heathen <S%H1471><s%> with thy hand <S%H3027><s%>, and plantedst <S%H5193><s%> them; how thou didst afflict <S%H7489><s%> the people <S%H3816><s%>, and cast them out <S%H7971><s%>.

For they got <S%H3423><s%> not the land <S%H776><s%> in possession <S%H3423><s%> by their own sword <S%H2719><s%>, neither did their own arm <S%H2220><s%> save <S%H3467><s%> them: but thy right hand <S%H3225><s%>, and thine arm <S%H2220><s%>, and the light <S%H216><s%> of thy countenance <S%H6440><s%>, because thou hadst a favour <S%H7521><s%> unto them.
Thou art my King <S%H4428><s%>, O God <S%H430><s%>: command <S%H6680><s%> deliverances <S%H3444><s%> for Jacob <S%H3290><s%>.
Through thee will we push down <S%H5055><s%> our enemies <S%H6862><s%>: through thy name <S%H8034><s%> will we tread them under <S%H947><s%> that rise up <S%H6965><s%> against us.
For I will not trust <S%H982><s%> in my bow <S%H7198><s%>, neither shall my sword <S%H2719><s%> save <S%H3467><s%> me.
But thou hast saved <S%H3467><s%> us from our enemies <S%H6862><s%>, and hast put them to shame <S%H954><s%> that hated <S%H8130><s%> us.
In God <S%H430><s%> we boast <S%H1984><s%> all the day <S%H3117><s%> long, and praise <S%H3034><s%> thy name <S%H8034><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>. Selah <S%H5542><s%>.
But <S%H637><s%> thou hast cast off <S%H2186><s%>, and put us to shame <S%H3637><s%>; and goest not forth <S%H3318><s%> with our armies <S%H6635><s%>.
Thou makest us to turn <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H268><s%> from the enemy <S%H6862><s%>: and they which hate <S%H8130><s%> us spoil <S%H8154><s%> for themselves.
Thou hast given <S%H5414><s%> us like sheep <S%H6629><s%> appointed for meat <S%H3978><s%>; and hast scattered <S%H2219><s%> us among the heathen <S%H1471><s%>.
Thou sellest <S%H4376><s%> thy people <S%H5971><s%> for nought <S%H1952><s%>, and dost not increase <S%H7235><s%> thy wealth by their price <S%H4242><s%>.
Thou makest <S%H7760><s%> us a reproach <S%H2781><s%> to our neighbours <S%H7934><s%>, a scorn <S%H3933><s%> and a derision <S%H7047><s%> to them that are round about <S%H5439><s%> us.
Thou makest <S%H7760><s%> us a byword <S%H4912><s%> among the heathen <S%H1471><s%>, a shaking <S%H4493><s%> of the head <S%H7218><s%> among the people <S%H3816><s%>.
My confusion <S%H3639><s%> is continually <S%H3117><s%> before me, and the shame <S%H1322><s%> of my face <S%H6440><s%> hath covered <S%H3680><s%> me,
For the voice <S%H6963><s%> of him that reproacheth <S%H2778><s%> and blasphemeth <S%H1442><s%>; by reason <S%H6440><s%> of the enemy <S%H341><s%> and avenger <S%H5358><s%>.
All this is come <S%H935><s%> upon us; yet have we not forgotten <S%H7911><s%> thee, neither have we dealt falsely <S%H8266><s%> in thy covenant <S%H1285><s%>.
Our heart <S%H3820><s%> is not turned <S%H5472><s%> back <S%H268><s%>, neither have our steps <S%H838><s%> declined <S%H5186><s%> from thy way <S%H734><s%>;
Though thou hast sore broken <S%H1794><s%> us in the place <S%H4725><s%> of dragons <S%H8577><s%>, and covered <S%H3680><s%> us with the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>.
If we have forgotten <S%H7911><s%> the name <S%H8034><s%> of our God <S%H430><s%>, or stretched out <S%H6566><s%> our hands <S%H3709><s%> to a strange <S%H2114><s%> god <S%H410><s%>;
Shall not God <S%H430><s%> search this out <S%H2713><s%>? for he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> the secrets <S%H8587><s%> of the heart <S%H3820><s%>.
Yea, for thy sake are we killed <S%H2026><s%> all the day <S%H3117><s%> long; we are counted <S%H2803><s%> as sheep <S%H6629><s%> for the slaughter <S%H2878><s%>.
Awake <S%H5782><s%>, why sleepest <S%H3462><s%> thou, O Lord <S%H136><s%>? arise <S%H6974><s%>, cast us not off <S%H2186><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%>.
Wherefore hidest <S%H5641><s%> thou thy face <S%H6440><s%>, and forgettest <S%H7911><s%> our affliction <S%H6040><s%> and our oppression <S%H3906><s%>?
For our soul <S%H5315><s%> is bowed down <S%H7743><s%> to the dust <S%H6083><s%>: our belly <S%H990><s%> cleaveth <S%H1692><s%> unto the earth <S%H776><s%>.
Arise <S%H6965><s%> for our help <S%H5833><s%>, and redeem <S%H6299><s%> us for thy mercies' <S%H2617><s%> sake.
